content.description:
Sit start with right hand on good hold on arete and left hand in crack. Traverse left and go up large, slopey sidepull.

Some longtime Castle Rock climber showed this to me a couple years ago and called it a "4-star V2".
content.location: SW corner of Hash rock. Right of #swag.

content.description: Start low on the crack and follow it to the top.
content.location: Located on Hash Rock right in front of the main Indian Rock. Following the trail from the parking lot will take you straight to it.

content.description: Start on the ledge and move left and up to a slopey top out.
content.location: Located on Hash Rock right in front of the main Indian Rock. Following the trail from the parking lot will take you straight to it.

content.description: Sit start on undercling. Move out left to get to the Hueco hole.
Start on the two pockets and mantle up. One move.
content.location: Located on Hash Rock right in front of the main Indian Rock. Following the trail from the parking lot will take you straight to it.

content.description:
high start begins on a right hand two finger pocket left hand on a crimp. heel hooking the jug with your right foot.

low start begins on a right hand sloper left hand in-cut side-pull again with a right foot heel
content.protection: landing is still crap, a spotter is recommended
content.location: from hash rock it is the clean, light grey face up the hill.

content.description:
Start

matched

​​​​​​​​​on the big chalked up hold in the center of the rock. Move up to the slopers to top out.

Start low with your right hand on the low right flake and left hand on the OK sloping crimp hold in the middle of the face. Find some beta to either match, go up left, or cross through right, to eventually find the difficult but manageable topout on small dishes.

I did not FA this, but I've always noticed these holds chalked up and was curious how it went. Let me know if there is FA/Grade/Name information out there. Felt V3-V4 the way I did it.
content.location: On Hash Rock on the flat face between "Sloper" and "SWAG"

content.description: Start crouched under the prow with a low right ridepull and chest-high left sidepull. Slap out right to some bad slopers. Delicately transition into the big gaston and top out.
content.location: NW corner of Hash rock. Right of The Undercling.
